Trade/Device Name(s): Unicel DxH 800 Cellular Analysis System with Early Sepsis Indicator Application
UniCel DxH 800 Coulter Cellular Analysis System with Early Sepsis Indicator Application
Regulation Name(s): Device to detect and measure non-microbial analyte(s) in human clinical specimens to aid in assessment of patients with suspected sepsis
Instrument(s)/Platform(s): UniCel DxH 800 Coulter Cellular Analysis System
Method(s)/Technology(ies): Whole blood analysis and cellular differentiation
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for Beckman Coulter UniCel DxH 800 Cellular Analysis System with Early Sepsis Indicator Application for quantitative measurement of monocyte distribution width (MDW) to aid early detection of sepsis in adult emergency department patients.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for quantitative measurement of Monocyte Distribution Width (MDW) from venous whole blood within 2 hours of collection to aid in identifying adult emergency department patients with sepsis or increased risk of developing sepsis within 12 hours of admission, used in conjunction with other laboratory findings and clinical information.
